Reviews.Title: Great Monitor But Be Aware!
Reviews.Author: Germy1979
Reviews.Content: This monitor works great.....Plugged in.  Before you click "add to cart", make sure you also grab a battery and place that in your cart as well.  This does not come with one, only the adapter.  Just putting that out there since now I have to wait for the battery for 2 weeks to get here.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic affordable monitor
Reviews.Author: Chris From Cutcycle
Reviews.Content: If you need all the features of the 700 - 800 dollar monitors, get one of those but if you're just looking to put up a larger image for someone pulling focus or a director, this is a great option with its many power supply options, BNC and HD connections and relatively sturdy build. The weight is fine and will mount problem-free with your articulated arm configuration. Would definitely recommend this.

Reviews.Title: Highest Resolution for the $
Reviews.Author: D. Wiesehahn
Reviews.Content: This is the highest resolution monitor for under $250. The battery plates and 4 pin xlr connector make it easy to power. It's a bargain, but of course not perfect. It has a cheap plastic feel, and many of the pro features like peaking and 1:1 are obviously absent. Also, the sun hood does not fold like on the Ruige monitors, which makes it cumbersome to transport. For not much money, it's a great focus monitor.

Reviews.Title: Feels far lighter and cheaper than I expected, even after reading reviews that said it was light and cheap
Reviews.Author: Sick of being tricked
Reviews.Content: Feels far lighter and cheaper than I expected, even after reading reviews that said it was light and cheap. That alone is a disappointment. No battery included -- must have been wishful thinking. Will try to update this after some use. Had I been able to handle it in a store I would not have spent $200 on this. You can't always judge performance or reliability by "feel", but this is pretty shocking and makes me more than a little wary.

Reviews.Title: Great Monitor
Reviews.Author: pianopeter55 "peter"
Reviews.Content: Great monitor!! comes with sunshade and a the swiggle thing! also a HDMI wire. It also comes with a power cable so you dont always need a battery.I picked up this battery that will work with this monitor for many hours:http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B001FA0B3U/ref=oh_details_o04_s00_i00Along with this charger:http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B000KU5CN0/ref=oh_details_o04_s00_i01

Reviews.Title: Nice Monitor - Great Customer Service
Reviews.Author: Mrs. Alice S. Franceschini
Reviews.Content: This is a nice monitor with great features. I'm very satisfied. The best part is the customer service. The kit is supposed to come with the different battery plates. Mine was missing one. I contacted Viviteq and they shipped out a replacement immediately; no questions asked.

Reviews.Title: One Small Detail
Reviews.Author: Bobby Graham
Reviews.Content: The product is great! Makes a huge difference looking at a 7 inch monitor vs. A 3 inch, I wish it would have included atleast one battery. Or said on the page in big red letters that no battery would be included. Other than that it was a smooth transaction.

Reviews.Title: If you are a professional, stay away from this monitor!
Reviews.Author: Sweeney "Conscientious Consumer"
Reviews.Content: This review is for the Lilliput 665. I'm a video professional. This monitor doesn't work for my professional needs; it's a toy, plain and simple. There was a blue artifact on the monitor and had to return it. Also, the aspect ratio hardly fills the whole screen and it's built like a plastic toy. If you are a hobbyist, maybe this will work for you, but try the slimmer Lilliput 668 first. Don't be tempted with this one, get another, trust me!

Reviews.Title: Doesn't work well with Canon cameras
Reviews.Author: paul wassermann
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed…instruction manual is essentially just a list of features, not how to use them or what they are for.  Couldn't get the output to fill the 7 inch screen except by pressing "pixel to pixel" but then the image isn't centered on display correctly so you can't see the red record spot (it is out of frame).  So in high res viewing you essentially have a four inch image on the 7 inch screen!  The "blink" is about five to eight seconds meaning you push the button to record and the monitor goes to blue screen for that length of time.  Finally customer service is awful.  I called and got a voice message to leave a phone number and "will call as soon as possible"  Three additional phone calls to them, five days elapsed and haven't heard anything.  Would not recommend this product without trying it first.  Sent mine back for refund.

Reviews.Title: Broken when I got it.
Reviews.Author: Mark Patino
Reviews.Content: I ordered this item and when I received it, it was already broken. Not made out of the best material. Ended up going with something else.

Reviews.Title: Great Monitor
Reviews.Author: Pablo D.
Reviews.Content: I bought this monitor after having a similar Marshall monitor that's more expensive.I'm pretty sure they are both the same monitor with different branding so don't pay the extra bucks for the marshall one.I sold this and got a bigger Lilliput monitor.I think this monitor doesn't have the ability to correct the weird aspect ratio that gets out of the Canon 60D that I use.It's very useful for framing and focusing, not so much for color assessment.There are lot's of Lilliput monitor options to choose from so pick yours depending on size, price, resolution, etc.

Reviews.Title: Wow Great
Reviews.Author: Albert
Reviews.Content: I used this for my video production company and I love the display and it makes shooting videos at a fixed location so much easier.  The only problem is the shoe does not feel solid, but I'll work with that and hope it holds up.

Reviews.Title: Good unit
Reviews.Author: Roderick
Reviews.Content: WORKS AS ADVERTISED! No problems out of this device at all. Highly recommend this product to whomever needs one for whatever. Crystal clear. I'm a new fan.

Reviews.Title: Great Monitor for field production
Reviews.Author: Michael Fleming
Reviews.Content: Met all my expectations. I love that it will work with my Sony batteries. Only improvement would be to add a stand or prop so it can stand on its own, but that is rigable.

Reviews.Title: Budget Monitor
Reviews.Author: Rodney Cooper
Reviews.Content: The 7" inch Lilliput is an awesome monitor to help pull focus when you're shooting music video's or general shooting. The only thing that was abnormal to me was when you press record on your camera, the Lilliput monitor has a short delay. And you won't be able to take advantage of using the entire screen if you're using a crop sensor camera because the aspect ratio is 4:3 on crop sensor camera's. All in all, this is a great monitor and I use it for all my video shoots!

Reviews.Title: Great product for the price
Reviews.Author: J. Brown
Reviews.Content: This is a great product considering the price.  HDMI, component and composite inputs plus the ability to use multiple battery types and DC power make this monitor a super value.  Great for field monitoring!
